content.description: Sit start with low hands in "CRACK", traverse right then pull up and place left foot in "CRACK" Then top out on knoby face. The Crux is getting from seated to toe-in manuever while passing low shelf.
content.location: South Face of Lone Star Boulder, left side of obvious low bowl feature

content.description: Start with hands low in wide juggy crack thats at about a 45 degree angle, then bring legs up and do an awkward knee bar or high step. Crux is the awkward footing after leaving the ground. Sit Start makes it V0+.
content.location: North Side of boulder, only wide juggy crack there.

content.description: Sit start with feet near natural deep pocket, with both hands just below first ledge. First move up to ledge, bump to second ledge,  long right hand to high crimp (2nd hardest move) then traverse right to the northernmost edge of the boulder. Use the bucket in the vertical center, then barn-door swing to place right foot on perfect little foot crop. Stem to far pockets (crux) and finish using nothing slopers.
Start lying down with feet in deep hole, then traverse up and right a few feet and top out. Crux is getting over hole to the right (Left is a different route).
content.location: South East side of boulder. 8ft right of Uranus.

content.description:
Start with the left hand on the lowest sloping bulge of the overhung face. Right hand starts on a pinch or crimp (depending on your preference) to the right of the sloping left hand.

Crux is really the only move of the problem. Reach directly up and over the lip for a solid sloper and match. walk feet up and top out
